data.question: What is the formula of the first metal-organic framework mentioned?
What role do bpy and Bu4NBr play in the synthesis of the metal-organic frameworks?
data.answer: They act as templates during the formation of the cages.

data.question: Is the framework of compound 1 stable up to 300 °C?
What is the yield percentage based on Cd(NO3)2·4H2O for the synthesis of compound 1?
Does the escape rate of guest molecules from the cages depend on the particle sizes of the MOFs?
What is the main structural difference between the coordination environments of Cd(1) and Cd(2) in the MOFs?
data.answer: Cd(1) is six-coordinated with four oxygen and two nitrogen atoms, while Cd(2) is coordinated to six symmetry related O(3) atoms.

data.question: Are the MOFs constructed by nanoscale cages via sharing the single-layer walls?
What is the chemical formula for the second metal-organic framework mentioned?
What is the significance of the 3^8 4^15 cage building unit (CBU) mentioned?
data.answer: It shows a new type of CBU that has not been observed in known zeolite CBUs.

data.question: Can compound 2 be obtained without the presence of Bu4N+ molecules?
What is the yield percentage for the synthesis of compound 2 based on Cd(NO3)2·4H2O?
Does the presence of bpy and Bu4N+ molecules influence the formation of the MOFs?
What is the role of IDC3- in the structure of the MOFs?
data.answer: IDC3- acts as a bridging ligand connecting Cd(II) ions to form the framework.

data.question: Are the MOFs mentioned in the text porous?
What is the approximate diameter of the nanoscale M21L12 cage mentioned?
Do the MOFs exhibit photoluminescence?
What is the main difference in thermal behavior between compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: Compound 1 shows different weight losses in crystalline and powder forms, while compound 2 shows similar TGA curves regardless of form.

data.question: Is the escape rate of guest molecules from the cages influenced by the presence of alkali metal ions?
What is the space group of the crystal structure for both compounds 1 and 2?
Does the structure of the MOFs resemble that of fullerene?
